First, repentance:

I only wish that the Buddhas of the ten directions, the great Bodhisattvas, and the noble Sangha of Arhats will remember me and bear witness to me. Whether in this world or in my past lives, since beginningless birth and death, I have been disturbed in body and mind by greed, anger, and delusion, and all afflictions, and have widely created various offenses. Towards the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha, my parents, teachers, and all Bodhisattvas, all noble beings, and other sentient beings with or without virtue, I have let loose the three karmas and committed various offenses, either by myself, encouraging others, or rejoicing in the actions of others. Such offenses are immeasurable and boundless. Before the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, I sincerely reveal them and repent with utmost sincerity.
After repenting once, I will never commit them again.
I only wish that the Buddhas of the ten directions and the great Bodhisattvas will have compassion and bear witness, so that my karmic hindrances may be extinguished.

Taking refuge in the Three Jewels is in order to eliminate the various sufferings of sentient beings. One should thus take refuge in the Three Jewels and contemplate the individual merits and virtues of the Three Jewels. Touching one's head to the ground, take refuge in this way, saying:

I, [name], from this life until I sit on the bodhi seat, take refuge in the TathÄgata's unsurpassed three bodies, take refuge in the vast MahÄyÄna Dharma-piá¹­aka, and take refuge in the assembly of all irreversible bodhisattvas. May all the buddhas and great bodhisattvas in the ten directions compassionately accept me.
One should thus take refuge in the Three Jewels.

As for giving rise to the bodhi mind, this bodhi mind is called the seed of the unsurpassed MahÄyÄna, able to bestow upon sentient beings the wonderful fruit of liberation and immortality. Therefore, earnestly cultivating and giving rise to siddhi:

In order to eliminate the immeasurable sufferings in the realm of sentient beings, to free them from the defilements of afflictions and transcend the three evil paths and the immeasurable sufferings of rebirth in the three existences, I will now serve as their shelter. For those without a master or support, I will be their support. For those crossing the ocean of birth and death, I will be their captain. For those who have lost their way, I will be their guide. For those without protection, I will be their savior. I will eliminate their sufferings and grant them happiness. I will eradicate all the afflictions and secondary afflictions of sentient beings and cause them to always contemplate wholesome actions without thinking of negative conditions. I will adorn their bodies with various merits and wisdom and diligently cultivate the six perfections without interruption, benefiting sentient beings and cultivating this merit together.

If in this life or in other lives I cultivate merit and wisdom to benefit sentient beings, I will cause all their afflictions and secondary afflictions to be crushed. I will diligently cultivate wholesome qualities up to enlightenment, and my mind will be unattached to unwholesome conditions.
One should give rise to the mind of enlightenment in this way.

One should also practice loving-kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity, peacefully abide in a single state of mind, always contemplate the six recollections, contemplate the mind, accord with the principle of nirvana, abandon and forever eliminate the grasping of conceptual thoughts.

As for the person who continues to sit in the seat and makes excellent vows, it is like the bodhisattvas who cultivate wholesome practices and extensively make excellent vows to benefit sentient beings. I too should be like this with my wholesome [roots].
I also vow to be able to eliminate the suffering of all sentient beings in the hells and so forth, perfect blessings and virtues, and realize the bliss of nirvana.

I also vow that all sentient beings will be abundantly wealthy, always be generous, be replete with wisdom, always harbor great patience, enjoy creating wholesome conditions, attain the knowledge of past lives, and have compassion for sentient beings. I vow that wherever all sentient beings are born, they will always attain such various excellent things.
